body_html:
@jart
Thanks for pointing me to the direction of StackOverflow. There I found the problem related to this "issue".
Apparently, a summary op triggers a dequeue everytime it is run.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40723307/tensorflow-how-to-run-summary-operation-without-triggering-dequeue

Could it be possible to implement the summary_op in such a way, that it doesn't automatically do a dequeue operation in the context of a normal session?

body:
@jart 
Thanks for pointing me to the direction of StackOverflow. There I found the problem related to this "issue".
Apparently, a summary op triggers a dequeue everytime it is run.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40723307/tensorflow-how-to-run-summary-operation-without-triggering-dequeue

Could it be possible to implement the summary_op in such a way, that it doesn't automatically do a dequeue operation in the context of a normal session?
